did.unittitle: Alpha Lambda Delta, Indiana University Chapter records

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: Alpha Lambda Delta. Indiana University Chapter.

did.abstract: The Alpha Lambda Delta fraternity was founded in 1924 at the University of Illinois as an honor society for freshmen women. The chapter at Indiana University was established in 1931. This collection consists of membership information, rules, awards, and the history of the organization.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open for research. Advance notice required.

bioghist.head: Administrative History
bioghist.p: Alpha Lambda Delta was founded in 1924 at the University of Illinois by Dean of Women Maria Leonard and Assistant Dean of Women Gladys Pennington to recognize the academic excellence of freshmen women. It was established in response to the creation of an honor society for men only, Phi Eta Sigma. Both of these groups were single-sex organizations until the passing of Title IX in the 1970s. The society became a national organization as more chapters were established, including the chapter at Indiana University, which was founded in 1931. Alpha Lambda Delta still exists today, celebrating academic excellence among freshmen and providing several thousand dollars of scholarships each year. There are over 275 chapters in the United States. At Indiana University, Alpha Lambda Delta and Phi Eta Sigma currently form a joint honor society that offers scholarships and leadership opportunities and coordinates social activities and service projects.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Collection is arranged alphabetically by file name.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of Alpha Lambda Delta materials removed from a binder that include IU chapter membership information, correspondence, history, and awards spanning 1924-1959. Additional materials in the collection include awards (1970-2009), publications (1983, 1999), membership and pledge lists (1931-1958), the society charter (1931), and a scrapbook (2002).

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Related photographs may be available in the University Archives Photographs Database.

userestrict.head: Usage Restrictions
userestrict.p: The donor(s) of this collection have not transferred their copyrights for the materials to the Trustees of Indiana University. For more information, please contact the Indiana University Archives staff.

The Indiana University Archives respects the intellectual property rights of others and does not claim any copyrights for non-university records, materials in the public domain, or materials for which we do not hold a Deed of Gift. Responsibility for the determination of the copyright status of these materials rests with those persons wishing to reuse the materials. Researchers are responsible for securing permission from copyright owners and any other rights holders for any reuse of these materials that extends beyond fair use or other statutory limitations.

Digital reproductions of archival materials from the Indiana University Archives are made available for noncommercial educational and research purposes only. If you are the copyright holder for any of the digitized materials and have questions about its inclusion on our site, please contact the Indiana University Archivist.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Item], Alpha Lambda Delta, Indiana University Chapter records, Collection C639, Indiana University Archives, Bloomington.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Given to the University Archives by IU Kelley School of Business, 2015 and 2016.

appraisal.head: Appraisal
appraisal.p: Notebook containing test scores for students removed and shredded.
